questions.question: Which sentence has any prepositional phrases in (parentheses) with the OP in bold?

choices.answer: The dog (on the porch) (stole my bagel.)
I waited (in the rain) (for my ride.)
We ran (inside after the storm.)
(After Lulu left,) we watched television (for an hour.)

questions.question: Which sentence has any prepositional phrases in (parentheses) with the OP in bold?

choices.answer: We are always late (for school) (because of my sister.)
(In November) my family is going (on a long trip.)
Mom said no (inspite of) my tears.
Please (put your books) away.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the correct troublesome preposition?

choices.answer: I don't have any homework besides math.
Today's schedule differs with yesterday's because of art.
Mom is so mad at me today!
I chose between my four favorite flavors.

questions.question: Which sentence does NOT use the correct troublesome preposition?

choices.answer: I differed with Mom about when to do my chores.
I had to chose among my three best friends!
Dad is angry with my sister today!
He stood besides his best friend at the concert.

questions.question: In which sentence is the word up being used as an adverb?

choices.answer: She ran up the stairs.
Throw that ball up into the sky.
Bobo climbed up the hill.
A spider is crawling up my leg!

questions.question: In which sentence is the word around being used as an adverb?

choices.answer: We looked all around for the key.
Around the yard ran my dogs.
Please check around your seat for scraps on the floor.
Something scary is around the corner!

questions.question: In which sentence is the word through being used as an preposition?

choices.answer: We walked through and closed the door.
Can we play through?
I looked through my things for my homework.
Her faith carried her through in difficult times.

questions.question: In which sentence is the word in being used as an preposition?

choices.answer: I found my pen in my pocket.
Jump in!
The judge said the ball was in, but the other team argued.
I want in because your plan sounds great!

questions.question: Which sentence has the adjective phrase in bold?

choices.answer: The woman on the bustalked loudly on her phone.
The woman on the bus talked loudly on her phone.
The woman on the bus talked loudly on her phone.
The woman on the bus talked loudly on her phone.

questions.question: Which sentence is using (under my bed) as an adjective phrase?

choices.answer: The books under my bed are valuable.
I hid the valuable books under my bed.
Under my bed is where I hid the valuable books.
The criminals looked under my bed for the books.

questions.question: Which sentence is using (after school) as an adverb phrase?

choices.answer: My time after school is precious.
After school is the time I do my best napping.
One time I never work too hard is after school.
After school I am going to take a nap.

questions.question: Which sentence has the adverb phrase in bold?

choices.answer: The pie on the counter was baked by Grandma.
The pie on the counter was baked by Grandma.
The pie on the counter was baked by Grandma.
The pie on the counter was baked by Grandma.

questions.question: Which sentence is using a noun phrase as the subject?

choices.answer: My favorite time of day is after dinner.
Once school gets out, we'll go on vacation.
Before dinner please wash your hands.
Inside my house is my favorite place to be.

questions.question: Which sentence is using a noun phrase as the subject complement?

choices.answer: My favorite time of day is after dinner.
Once school gets out, we'll go on vacation.
Before dinner please was your hands.
Inside my house is my favorite place to be.

questions.question: Which sentence is using a noun phrase as the subject?

choices.answer: After school, we will go to the store.
Before I took the test, I asked for help.
Before the test is the time to ask for help.
The best time to shop is after school.

questions.question: Which sentence is using a noun phrase as the subject complement?

choices.answer: After school, we will go to the store.
Before I took the test, I asked for help.
Before the test is the time to ask for help.
The best time to shop is after school.

questions.question: Say hello to the man next to me. The phrase in bold is a(n):

choices.answer: adjective phrase
adverb phrase
noun phrase
flibbety phrase

questions.question: Put that table next to me. The phrase in bold is a(n):

choices.answer: adjective phrase
adverb phrase
noun phrase
flibbety phrase

questions.question: Next to me is where you belong! The phrase in bold is a(n):

choices.answer: adjective phrase
adverb phrase
noun phrase
flibbety phrase

questions.question: Next Christmas we'll go carolling. The phrase in bold is a(n):

choices.answer: adjective phrase
adverb phrase
noun phrase
flibbety phrase
